intro: Scepseothamnus vinosa, commonly known as red sandreed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its reddish stems and leaves are distinctive features, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Scepseothamnus vinosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
